speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: SCENE II. The same. Before Calchas' tent.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Enter DIOMEDES

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: What, are you up here, ho? speak.

speaker: CALCHAS
text_entry: [Within]  Who calls?

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Calchas, I think. Where's your daughter?

speaker: CALCHAS
text_entry: [Within]  She comes to you.

speaker: CALCHAS
text_entry: Enter TROILUS and ULYSSES, at a distance; after them, THERSITES

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Stand where the torch may not discover us.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Enter CRESSIDA

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Cressid comes forth to him.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: How now, my charge!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Now, my sweet guardian! Hark, a word with you.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Whispers

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Yea, so familiar!

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: She will sing any man at first sight.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: And any man may sing her, if he can take her cliff;

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: she's noted.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Will you remember?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Remember! yes.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Nay, but do, then;

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: And let your mind be coupled with your words.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: What should she remember?

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: List.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Sweet honey Greek, tempt me no more to folly.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Roguery!

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Nay, then,--

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: I'll tell you what,--

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Foh, foh! come, tell a pin: you are forsworn.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: In faith, I cannot: what would you have me do?

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: A juggling trick,--to be secretly open.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: What did you swear you would bestow on me?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: I prithee, do not hold me to mine oath;

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Bid me do any thing but that, sweet Greek.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Good night.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Hold, patience!

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: How now, Trojan!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Diomed,--

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: No, no, good night: I'll be your fool no more.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Thy better must.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Hark, one word in your ear.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: O plague and madness!

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: You are moved, prince; let us depart, I pray you,

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Lest your displeasure should enlarge itself

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: To wrathful terms: this place is dangerous;

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: The time right deadly; I beseech you, go.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Behold, I pray you!

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Nay, good my lord, go off:

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: You flow to great distraction; come, my lord.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I pray thee, stay.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: You have not patience; come.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I pray you, stay; by hell and all hell's torments

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I will not speak a word!

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: And so, good night.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Nay, but you part in anger.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Doth that grieve thee?

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: O wither'd truth!

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Why, how now, lord!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: By Jove,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I will be patient.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Guardian!--why, Greek!

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Foh, foh! adieu; you palter.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: In faith, I do not: come hither once again.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: You shake, my lord, at something: will you go?

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: You will break out.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: She strokes his cheek!

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Come, come.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Nay, stay; by Jove, I will not speak a word:

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: There is between my will and all offences

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: A guard of patience: stay a little while.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: How the devil Luxury, with his fat rump and

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: potato-finger, tickles these together! Fry, lechery, fry!

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: But will you, then?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: In faith, I will, la; never trust me else.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Give me some token for the surety of it.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: I'll fetch you one.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: You have sworn patience.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Fear me not, sweet lord;

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I will not be myself, nor have cognition

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Of what I feel: I am all patience.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Re-enter CRESSIDA

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Now the pledge; now, now, now!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Here, Diomed, keep this sleeve.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: O beauty! where is thy faith?

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: My lord,--

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I will be patient; outwardly I will.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: You look upon that sleeve; behold it well.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: He loved me--O false wench!--Give't me again.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Whose was't?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: It is no matter, now I have't again.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: I will not meet with you to-morrow night:

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: I prithee, Diomed, visit me no more.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Now she sharpens: well said, whetstone!

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: I shall have it.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: What, this?

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Ay, that.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: O, all you gods! O pretty, pretty pledge!

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Thy master now lies thinking in his bed

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Of thee and me, and sighs, and takes my glove,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: And gives memorial dainty kisses to it,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: As I kiss thee. Nay, do not snatch it from me;

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: He that takes that doth take my heart withal.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: I had your heart before, this follows it.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: I did swear patience.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: You shall not have it, Diomed; faith, you shall not;

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: I'll give you something else.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: I will have this: whose was it?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: It is no matter.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Come, tell me whose it was.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: 'Twas one's that loved me better than you will.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: But, now you have it, take it.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Whose was it?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: By all Diana's waiting-women yond,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: And by herself, I will not tell you whose.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: To-morrow will I wear it on my helm,

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: And grieve his spirit that dares not challenge it.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Wert thou the devil, and worest it on thy horn,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: It should be challenged.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Well, well, 'tis done, 'tis past: and yet it is not;

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: I will not keep my word.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Why, then, farewell;

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Thou never shalt mock Diomed again.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: You shall not go: one cannot speak a word,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: But it straight starts you.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: I do not like this fooling.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Nor I, by Pluto: but that that likes not you pleases me best.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: What, shall I come? the hour?

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Ay, come:--O Jove!--do come:--I shall be plagued.

speaker: DIOMEDES
text_entry: Farewell till then.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Good night: I prithee, come.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Exit DIOMEDES

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Troilus, farewell! one eye yet looks on thee

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: But with my heart the other eye doth see.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Ah, poor our sex! this fault in us I find,

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: The error of our eye directs our mind:

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: What error leads must err; O, then conclude

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Minds sway'd by eyes are full of turpitude.

speaker: CRESSIDA
text_entry: Exit

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: A proof of strength she could not publish more,

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Unless she said ' My mind is now turn'd whore.'

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: All's done, my lord.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: It is.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Why stay we, then?

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: To make a recordation to my soul

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Of every syllable that here was spoke.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: But if I tell how these two did co-act,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Shall I not lie in publishing a truth?

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Sith yet there is a credence in my heart,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: An esperance so obstinately strong,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: That doth invert the attest of eyes and ears,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: As if those organs had deceptious functions,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Created only to calumniate.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Was Cressid here?

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: I cannot conjure, Trojan.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: She was not, sure.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Most sure she was.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Why, my negation hath no taste of madness.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Nor mine, my lord: Cressid was here but now.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Let it not be believed for womanhood!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Think, we had mothers; do not give advantage

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: To stubborn critics, apt, without a theme,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: For depravation, to square the general sex

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: By Cressid's rule: rather think this not Cressid.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: What hath she done, prince, that can soil our mothers?

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Nothing at all, unless that this were she.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Will he swagger himself out on's own eyes?

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: This she? no, this is Diomed's Cressida:

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: If beauty have a soul, this is not she;

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: If souls guide vows, if vows be sanctimonies,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: If sanctimony be the gods' delight,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: If there be rule in unity itself,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: This is not she. O madness of discourse,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: That cause sets up with and against itself!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Bi-fold authority! where reason can revolt

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Without perdition, and loss assume all reason

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Without revolt: this is, and is not, Cressid.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Within my soul there doth conduce a fight

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Of this strange nature that a thing inseparate

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Divides more wider than the sky and earth,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: And yet the spacious breadth of this division

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Admits no orifex for a point as subtle

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: As Ariachne's broken woof to enter.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Instance, O instance! strong as Pluto's gates;

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Cressid is mine, tied with the bonds of heaven:

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Instance, O instance! strong as heaven itself;

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: The bonds of heaven are slipp'd, dissolved, and loosed;

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: And with another knot, five-finger-tied,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: The fractions of her faith, orts of her love,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: The fragments, scraps, the bits and greasy relics

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Of her o'er-eaten faith, are bound to Diomed.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: May worthy Troilus be half attach'd

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: With that which here his passion doth express?

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Ay, Greek; and that shall be divulged well

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: In characters as red as Mars his heart

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Inflamed with Venus: never did young man fancy

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: With so eternal and so fix'd a soul.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Hark, Greek: as much as I do Cressid love,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: So much by weight hate I her Diomed:

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: That sleeve is mine that he'll bear on his helm;

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Were it a casque composed by Vulcan's skill,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: My sword should bite it: not the dreadful spout

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Which shipmen do the hurricano call,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Constringed in mass by the almighty sun,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Shall dizzy with more clamour Neptune's ear

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: In his descent than shall my prompted sword

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Falling on Diomed.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: He'll tickle it for his concupy.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: O Cressid! O false Cressid! false, false, false!

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Let all untruths stand by thy stained name,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: And they'll seem glorious.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: O, contain yourself

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Your passion draws ears hither.

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: Enter AENEAS

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: I have been seeking you this hour, my lord:

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Hector, by this, is arming him in Troy;

speaker: AENEAS
text_entry: Ajax, your guard, stays to conduct you home.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Have with you, prince. My courteous lord, adieu.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Farewell, revolted fair! and, Diomed,

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Stand fast, and wear a castle on thy head!

speaker: ULYSSES
text_entry: I'll bring you to the gates.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Accept distracted thanks.

speaker: TROILUS
text_entry: Exeunt TROILUS, AENEAS, and ULYSSES

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Would I could meet that rogue Diomed! I would

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: croak like a raven; I would bode, I would bode.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Patroclus will give me any thing for the

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: intelligence of this whore: the parrot will not

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: do more for an almond than he for a commodious drab.

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Lechery, lechery; still, wars and lechery; nothing

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: else holds fashion: a burning devil take them!

speaker: THERSITES
text_entry: Exit
